Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler

Interface ConnectedState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SMTPConnection
    public interface ConnectedState
    Operations available immediately after a client connection is established.

    This interface is provided to ClientConnected.connected(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ConnectionInfo, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.ConnectedState) and allows the handler to either accept or reject the connection.

    Accepting the connection sends a 220 greeting to the client and transitions to the hello state where HELO/EHLO commands are expected. Rejecting the connection sends a 554 error and closes the connection.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ClientConnected.connected(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ConnectionInfo, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.ConnectedState), HelloHandler

    • Method Detail

      • acceptConnection

        void acceptConnection​(java.lang.String greeting,
                      HelloHandler handler)
        Accepts the connection and sends a greeting banner.

        Sends a 220 response to the client with the specified greeting message and transitions to the hello state where HELO/EHLO commands are expected.

        The greeting message typically includes the server hostname and optionally indicates ESMTP support. For example: 

         "mail.example.com ESMTP Service ready"
        Parameters:
        greeting - the greeting text to send (without the 220 code)
        handler - receives the client's HELO/EHLO command

      • rejectConnection

        void rejectConnection()
        Rejects the connection with a default message.

        Sends a 554 response and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

      • rejectConnection

        void rejectConnection​(java.lang.String message)
        Rejects the connection with a custom message.

        Sends a 554 response with the specified message and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message (without the 554 code)

      • serverShuttingDown

        void serverShuttingDown()
        Server is shutting down, close gracefully.

        Sends a 421 response indicating the server is shutting down and closes the connection.
